data.title: Hotel booze rules relaxed over New Year
data.description: Hotel guests will be allowed to order alcoholic drinks to their rooms from in-house bars and restaurants around the clock over the  New Year , according to the Alcoholic Beverage Control Board.

data.title: SSO may use Swedish scheme as new model
data.description: The Labour Ministry will study Sweden

data.title: Govt opens school bus safety management centre
data.description: Ayutthaya: The Education Ministry is promoting a school bus safety management centre in Ayutthaya as a model for other schools nationwide to improve transport safety for students.

data.title: Suriya insists SRT owns land
data.description: Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit said a disputed 5,083-rai plot of land in Buri Ram

data.title: iCon may lose licence over fraud claims
data.description: The Office of the Consumer Protection Board (OCPB) is considering revoking the licence of scandal-hit The iCon Group, Prime Minister

data.title: Thaksin petition is 'dismissed' by OAG
data.description: The Office of the Attorney General (OAG) has rejected lawyer Teerayut Suwankesorn

data.title: Thailand, China set for 'Golden Jubilee'
data.description: Thailand and China have launched a logo for the golden jubilee marking 50 years of diplomatic ties between the two nations next year.

data.title: Hotel booze rules relaxed over NY
data.description: Hotel guests will be allowed to order alcoholic drinks to their rooms from in-house bars and restaurants around the clock over the  New Year , according to the Alcoholic Beverage Control Board.

data.title: Trio busted for fake powdered milk
data.description: NAKHON PATHOM - A Chinese national and two Thais have been arrested for distributing counterfeit  powdered milk .

data.title: Drugs found hidden in Buddha statues
data.description: NAKHON PHANOM - Border patrol police officers have found over 100 kilogrammes of  heroin  and  crystal methamphetamine  hidden inside three Buddha statues that were left on a roadside in Tha Uthen district of this northeastern province.

data.title: Foreigner falls to death at Korat mall
data.description: NAKHON RATCHASIMA - A foreign man has fallen to his death from the fourth floor of the Terminal 21 Korat shopping mall.

data.title: Cat owner, others in poisoning scene face cruelty charges
data.description: The Department of Livestock Development has completed its inquiry into the use of a drugged cat in the production of a Thai period drama, and the cat’s owner and other people involved will be charged with animal cruelty.

data.title: Aussie women gravely ill from tainted booze in Laos
data.description: Two young Australian women are fighting for their lives in Thai hospitals after drinking  tainted alcohol  in the tourist town of Vang Vieng in Laos.

data.title: Thaksin expects fugitive sister Yingluck to return by April
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra expects his younger sister, fugitive former prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra, to return to Thailand around April next year.

data.title: Chiang Mai krathong waste drops 25%
data.description: CHIANG MAI - Twenty-five tonnes of krathong floats and garbage have been collected from the Ping River after Friday’s  Loy Krathong  festival, down from 33 tonnes last year.

data.title: Thai PM Paetongtarn speaks with Trump
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra had a phone call with US President-elect Donald Trump, her office said on Tuesday, during which they both pledged to support each others’ administrations.

data.title: Drunken Briton injured by Good Samaritans on ride home
data.description: PATTAYA — A British tourist, too drunk to get into a taxi, ended up in a fistfight with two Good Samaritans who volunteered to drive him home in the early hours of Tuesday in this eastern seaside tourist town.

data.title: Ethereum co-founder visits Moo Deng
data.description: Ethereum blockchain co-founder Vitalik Buterin has visited the Khao Kheow Open Zoo in Chon Buri to see star attraction Moo Deng, the baby pigmy hippo, and the other animals.

data.title: Joint panel to thrash out  differences on referendum
data.description: Disagreements surrounding the referendum bill may be settled as early as tomorrow, with opposing parties set to strike a deal on a "one and a half" majority rule as an alternative to the double majority requirement to pass a referendum.

data.title: Tech start-ups get extra funds
data.description: The Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation Ministry announced an increase of almost 20% of its technology fund for 270 projects to support tech entrepreneurs expand their start-up ventures for next year.

data.title: Joint panel to thrash out  differences on referendum
data.description: Disagreements surrounding the referendum bill may be settled as early as tomorrow, with opposing parties set to strike a deal on a "one and a half" majority rule as an alternative to the double majority requirement to pass a referendum.

data.title: War 'no obstacle' to ramping up relations
data.description: The war between  Ukraine  and  Russia  officially enters its 1,000th day on Tuesday, but despite the ongoing conflict, Kyiv remains committed to strengthening ties with countries in Southeast Asia to create new partnerships for mutual growth and secure additional assistance to end the war and get justice for its citizens.

data.title: PM urged to return land to monastery
data.description: Former senator Somchai Sawangkarn sent a third open letter to Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, urging her to expedite the return of a monastic plot of land acquired by Alpine Golf Course to Wat Thamikararam Worawihan, saying that the head of the government must perform her duties with honesty for the benefit of the country.

data.title: Key panel appointment for negotiation with Cambodia may face delay
data.description: The planned appointment of the Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with  Cambodia  on the development of  disputed maritime areas  in the  Gulf of Thailand  might not be tabled for the cabinet

data.title: New booze control bill nearly ready
data.description: The chairman of the special committee scrutinising new alcohol control legislation, Wisarn Techathirawat, said the draft of the  Alcoholic Beverage Control  Bill was about 80% complete and would be submitted to parliament in mid-December.

data.title: Stimulus plan in the works
data.description: The Finance Ministry will on Tuesday present a comprehensive economic stimulus package to a related committee chaired by Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for consideration, said Deputy Finance Minister Julapun Amornvivat.

data.title: Inquiry into Thailand's rising dugong death toll expanded
data.description: Another  dugong  was found dead in Krabi on Sunday as the Natural Resources and Environment Minister Chalermchai Sri-on directed relevant authorities to expedite urgent measures concerning the  alarming increase  in the dugong death rate.

data.title: Thailand to return rare animals to Madagascar
data.description: Thailand will return over 900  lemurs  and rare  turtles  seized from the illegal wildlife trade to  Madagascar  this month, according to the Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP).

data.title: Singer quits Palang Pracharath Party amid extortion probe
data.description: Singer Rattapoom “Film” Tokongsup has resigned from the opposition Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) amid a probe into alleged  extortion  related to  The iCon Group  case.

data.title: Inquiry into increasing dugong death expanded
data.description: Another dugong was found dead in Krabi on Sunday as the Natural Resources and Environment Minister Chalermchai Sri-on directed relevant authorities to expedite urgent measures concerning the alarming increase in the dugong death rate.

data.title: Govt to return rare animals to Madagascar
data.description: Thailand will return over 900 lemurs and rare turtles seized from the illegal wildlife trade to Madagascar this month, according to the Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP).

data.description: The People

data.description: Singer Rattapoom “Film” Tokongsup has resigned from the opposition Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) amid a probe into alleged  extortion  related to  The iCon Group  case.

data.title: Grand parade for arrival of Lord Buddha’s tooth
data.description: The government will organise a grand parade for the arrival of Lord Buddha

data.title: Inspection deadline looms for gas-powered tour buses
data.description: The Department of Land Transport has warned the operators of almost 6,000 natural gas-powered (CNG) buses they must present their vehicles for safety inspection  before Nov 30 or be put off the road.

data.title: Phuket hails off-season tourist boom
data.description: Phuket

data.title: Scams lead to B718m in losses
data.description: Fraudulent accounts on Facebook caused 718 million baht in damages in the past year, says Digital Economy and Society Minister Prasert Jantararuangtong.
